section:
Class List Here are the classes, structs, unions and interfaces with brief descriptions:Adder
This class represents an adder, it gets a number and adds 1 to it Data
A Data class that provides access to various forms of manipulation and allocation for the processing units Data::DataKey
This structure works like a std::pair but its member names are meaningful and are used to store data paired to a particular key EdgeDetector
This processing unit detects the borders inside the img and sends them as a new image through the pipe ImgOutputer
This class represents an ImgOutputer, it gets an img matrix with unsigned char values and sends it to the IO for creating two .ppm files ImgTruncator
This processing unit gets an array of heights and sets all values as multiples of 100 MemoryManager
A memory manager that provides an interface for managing a fixed-size queue of pointers to memory buffers NumberPrinter
This class outputs the number inside the data to the standard output Pipeline
Class representing the pipeline for the processing of any type of data PipeNode
Class representing a single node in a processing pipeline ProcessingUnitInterface
This class is the parent class of all the processing units we will create Semaphore
A class that implements a semaphore
